title: Unicorn
credit_line: Gift of Mrs. Charles L. Snowdon, Jr. in honor of the Women's Committee
provenance_text:
Claude Domec [1902-1983], New York, NY [1]; Andre J. Seligmann, New York, NY [2]; Mrs. Charles L. Snowdon, Jr., Aspinwall, PA and Wilmington, Delaware, November 1943 until October 9, 1975 [3]; her gift to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October 1975.

Notes:
[1]. French artist Claude Domec lived in the United Sates in the 1940s.
[2]. Mr. Seligmann was acting as Mr. Domec's agent.  See copy of relevant correspondence in curatorial file.
[3]. The painting was exhibited in the 1943 "Painting in the United States" exhibition at Carnegie Institute, Pittsburgh, PA, October-December 1943 (no. 25.) Mrs. Ruth J. Snowdon purchased the painting from the exhibition for $400 (check dated November 24, 1943.)
